dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, what a wild end to the week, huh? I mean, after those brutal losses, US stocks actually saw a pretty sharp rebound on Friday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host_B, what a wild end to the week, huh? I mean, after those brutal losses, U S stocks actually saw a pretty sharp rebound on Friday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fresh off their worst losses since 1987, U.S. stocks rebounded sharply following President Trumps announcement that the coronavirus pandemic would be declared a national emergency, a move that will free up as much as $50 billion in federal aid to help combat the crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. Like, it was a much-needed breath of fresh air, especially after, you know, the worst losses since '87. That was all thanks to President Trump declaring a national emergency, freeing up like fifty billion in federal aid.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. Like, it was a much-needed breath of fresh air, especially after, you know, the worst losses since one thousand, nine hundred eighty seven. That was all thanks to President Trump declaring a national emergency, freeing up like fifty billion in federal aid.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fresh off their worst losses since 1987, U.S. stocks rebounded sharply following President Trumps announcement that the coronavirus pandemic would be declared a national emergency, a move that will free up as much as $50 billion in federal aid to help combat the crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. I mean, the Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaqâ€”all soared by about 9.3% right after he started speaking. Just minutes later!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. I mean, the Dow, S and P five hundred, Nasdaq-all soared by about nine point three percent right after he started speaking. Just minutes later!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wild. And it wasn't just the market reacting. You had, uh, big retail CEOs there, like from Walmart and CVS, talking about supply chain support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild. And it wasn't just the market reacting. You had, uh, big retail C E Os there, like from Walmart and C V S, talking about supply chain support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And he also talked about waiving student debt interest, and like, buying crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. Which, you know, gave WTI Crude a bit of a bump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And he also talked about waiving student debt interest, and like, buying crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. Which, you know, gave W T I Crude a bit of a bump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A bump, yeah, 4.5% up for the day. But I mean, speaking of oil, that price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia, that's still a huge deal, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A bump, yeah, four point five percent up for the day. But I mean, speaking of oil, that price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia, that's still a huge deal, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Oh, for sure. Prices plummeted all week because of that. But still, despite Friday's rally, we're still in the red for the week, aren't we? Dow's down, uh, 10%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. Prices plummeted all week because of that. But still, despite Friday's rally, we're still in the red for the week, aren't we? Dow's down, uh, ten percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's been a tough one. And, you know, the actual coronavirus numbers, they're still climbing pretty fast here in the US. Over seventeen hundred infected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's been a tough one. And, you know, the actual coronavirus numbers, they're still climbing pretty fast here in the U S. Over seventeen hundred infected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the United States continued to grow at an alarming rate this week, with more than 1,741 infected and 41 people dead as of Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, a lot of companies are, like, mandating work from home. Some are even starting layoffs already, like Norwegian Air.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, a lot of companies are, like, mandating work from home. Some are even starting layoffs already, like Norwegian Air.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many companies are implementing mandatory work from policies, and others, like Norwegian Air, are already beginning to lay off workers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a really challenging time. But hey, Google got a little boost, right? For that new testing website?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a really challenging time. But hey, Google got a little boost, right? For that new testing website?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, Trump praised them, so their stock jumped 9%. A small win, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, Trump praised them, so their stock jumped nine percent. A small win, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what does this all mean for the long run? I mean, markets always recover from bear markets, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what does this all mean for the long run? I mean, markets always recover from bear markets, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it is hard to tell when and where the market will bottom, we do know that the market has always recovered from bear markets, says Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what Lindsey Bell, an investment strategist, says. But, uh, the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in past bear markets since '46.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what Lindsey Bell, an investment strategist, says. But, uh, the S and P five hundred has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in past bear markets since one thousand, nine hundred forty six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, it may take a while to get back to new highs the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in all bear markets since 1946.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, we're in for, like, a bit of a marathon, not a sprint here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we're in for, like, a bit of a marathon, not a sprint here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Keep those seatbelts fastened.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Keep those seatbelts fastened.
